clinical_study.brief_title: Study on the Relationship Between Periodontitis and Renal Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Affiliated Hospital of Stomatology, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Analysis of inflammatory markers in periodontitis and patients with early and middle stage renal disease.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 200 population is recruited, individuals are divided into four groups according to a periodontal examination and a general physical examination: healthy individuals ,periodontitis, renal disease patients with healthy periodontium, and renal disease patients wth peridontitis. Fasting blood samples and gingival crevicular fluid are collected from all individuals, and inflammatory markers are analysed for the four groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory markers analysis of the four groups
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of inflammatory biomarkers of blood and gingival crevicular fluid samples of the four groups

arm_group.description: patients with 1-4 stage K/DOQI (Kidney Disease Outcome Quality Initiative) chronic kidney disease, but healthy periodontium
patients with periodontitis, but healthy renal conditions
patients with 1-4 stage K/DOQI (Kidney Disease Outcome Quality Initiative) chronic kidney disease and periodontitis

study_pop.textblock: 50 individuals are recruited for each group, the factors of age and gender are matched while selecting the incruited indiduals,all participants were in general good health(except renal disease) and non-smoking.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all participants were in general good health(except renal disease) and non-smoking
Exclusion Criteria:
- less than 20 teeth in the dentin
- hypertension
- the presence of systemic disease (e.g., diabetes mellitus ,coronary heart disease, liver, or lung disease)
- a history or the symptom of any other acute or chronic infections
- systemic antibiotic treatment within previous 4 weeks
- periodontal treatment within1 month
